name: Oven-Baked Beef Stew
author: Anonymous
summary: This is a simple beef stew that is finished in the oven. If you get a lean piece of beef with a bone, cook the bone with the stew, as it adds a lot of flavor.
ingredients: ¼ cup flour, or as needed
¾ pound cubed beef stew meat
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Pour flour into a shallow bowl and turn beef in flour, shaking meat to remove excess flour
Heat oil in an ovenproof casserole dish over high heat
Brown beef cubes in hot oil in batches on all sides, about 5 minutes per batch
Add onion, celery, and carrots to the casserole dish, reduce heat to medium, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute
Return beef to the casserole dish and stir in bay leaves
Bake in the preheated oven until beef is tender, 1 1/2 to 2 hours
Remove bay leaves before serving and season with salt and pepper
